trainings.title: Sustainable Organic Farming Techniques - 3 Week Program

sessions.topic: Introduction to Sustainable Farming & Soil Health

trainings.targetAudience: Farmers seeking sustainable agricultural practices and organic certification

description.brief: Comprehensive three-week training program on sustainable and organic farming techniques for small and medium-scale farmers.
description.full: This intensive training program covers essential sustainable farming practices including organic pest management, soil health improvement, water conservation, and crop rotation strategies. Participants gain hands-on experience through field demonstrations, practical exercises, and real farm visits. The course is designed to help farmers transition to organic methods and potentially achieve organic certification.
objectives: Master principles of sustainable agriculture and organic farming
Implement organic pest control methods without chemical pesticides
Improve soil health through natural composting techniques
Develop water conservation and irrigation strategies
Plan and execute effective crop rotation systems

topics: Introduction to organic methods and certification
Field visit to successful organic farm
Organic pesticide preparation from neem, chili, etc.
Marketing organic produce and certification process

outcomes: Ability to implement sustainable practices on own farm
Reduced dependency on chemical inputs by 70%+
Improved soil health and long-term crop yields
Cost savings of ₹15,000-₹25,000 per acre annually

certificate.criteria: Attend all 3 sessions (minimum 90% attendance) and complete practical assignments

trainings.title: Traditional Seed Preservation & Seed Bank Management
trainings.targetAudience: Farmers, homemakers, and seed savers interested in preserving indigenous crop varieties

description.brief: One-day intensive training on traditional seed preservation methods, seed bank setup, and maintaining indigenous crop diversity.
description.full: Learn the art and science of preserving indigenous seeds through this comprehensive hands-on training. Participants will master traditional and modern seed storage techniques, understand seed viability testing, and learn to establish community seed banks. This training emphasizes the critical importance of maintaining genetic diversity in crops for food security and climate resilience.
objectives: Understand importance of seed preservation for food security and biodiversity
Master traditional seed cleaning, drying, and storage techniques
Learn to identify high-quality seeds and test viability
Set up home or community seed banks
Document and catalog indigenous seed varieties

topics: Introduction to seed sovereignty and biodiversity
Traditional vs modern seed preservation methods
Hands-on seed cleaning and drying techniques
Seed storage containers and environmental control
Seed exchange networks and legal aspects

outcomes: Ability to preserve seeds for 2-5 years with high viability
Knowledge of 20+ indigenous crop varieties suitable for region
Skills to run home or community seed bank
Understanding of seed laws and farmers' rights
Network with other seed savers in Tamil Nadu

facilitators.title: Traditional Seed Keeper & Community Organizer
facilitators.bio: 30+ years maintaining indigenous seed varieties, trained 500+ farmers in seed preservation

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in seed preservation, gardening, or farming
whatToBring: Seeds from home garden (optional for practice)

logistics.materials: Seed preservation starter kit worth ₹300 provided to all participants
